name: biomni-annotate-bacterial-genome
title: Biomni: Annotate Bacterial Genome
description: Annotate a bacterial genome using Prokka to identify genes, proteins, and functional features
content:
Overview

Performs comprehensive bacterial genome annotation using Prokka, a rapid prokaryotic genome annotation tool. This automated pipeline identifies and annotates genes, coding sequences (CDS), ribosomal RNA, transfer RNA, and other functional genomic features. The tool provides detailed functional predictions and gene product descriptions essential for understanding bacterial capabilities and metabolism.

Input Parameters

  • genome_file_path (required): Path to the bacterial genome assembly file (FASTA format)
  • output_dir (optional, default: 'annotation_results'): Directory where annotation results will be saved
  • genus (optional): Genus name of the organism for improved annotation accuracy
  • species (optional): Species name of the organism
  • strain (optional): Strain identifier for the organism
  • prefix (optional): Prefix for output file naming

Input Format

{
  "genome_file_path": "/path/to/bacterial_genome.fasta",
  "output_dir": "annotation_output",
  "genus": "Escherichia",
  "species": "coli",
  "strain": "K12",
  "prefix": "ecoli_k12"
}

Biological Use Case

Critical for microbiology research involving:

  • Characterization of newly sequenced bacterial isolates
  • Comparative genomics studies across bacterial strains
  • Identification of virulence factors and antimicrobial resistance genes
  • Metabolic pathway reconstruction and analysis
  • Functional genomics and systems biology studies
  • Pathogen surveillance and outbreak investigation

Output

Produces comprehensive annotation results including:

  • GFF3 file with genomic feature coordinates and annotations
  • GenBank format file for database submission
  • Annotated coding sequences and protein predictions
  • Ribosomal RNA and transfer RNA locations
  • Functional annotations and gene product descriptions
  • Summary statistics report (genome_annotation_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
